snippet: The drop-off in talent after the Big Three is enormous, a quandary the Knicks created for themselves when they shipped four starters to Denver for Carmelo Anthony last February.
abstract: Howard Beck On Basketball column notes that New York Knicks have a bench that is a patchwork of rookies, aging veterans and marginal players; holds that lack of depth is a quandary Knicks created for themselves when they shipped four starters to Denver in exchange for star forward Carmelo Anthony in February 2011.
lead_paragraph: The drop-off in talent after the Big Three is enormous, a quandary the Knicks created for themselves when they shipped four starters to Denver for Carmelo Anthony last February.

headline.main: Where Knicks’ Depth Might Have Been, Questions Abound
headline.print_headline: Where Knicks’ Depth Might Have Been, Questions Abound
